item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Walmart Logo Walmart Inc. is an American multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. Source The Walmart History Walmart as Walmart know it today evolved from Sam Walton’s goals for great value and great customer service. “Mr. Sam,” as he was known, believed in leadership through service. This belief that true leadership depends on willing service was the principle on which Walmart was built, and drove the decisions the company has made for the past 50 years.
You can download the Walmart logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Walmart
item.description: Walmart Inc. is an American multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. Source The Walmart History Walmart as Walmart know it today evolved from Sam Walton’s goals for great value and great customer service. “Mr. Sam,” as he was known, believed in leadership through service. This belief that true leadership depends on willing service was the principle on which Walmart was built, and drove the decisions the company has made for the past 50 years.

BJ's Wholesale Club Logo BJ’s Wholesale Club Holdings, Inc., commonly referred as BJ’s, is an American membership-only warehouse club chain operating on the East Coast of the United States and the state of Ohio. Source
You can download the BJs logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: BJs

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Costco Wholesale Corporation Logo
Costco Wholesale Corporation, doing business as Costco, is an American multinational corporation which operates a chain of membership-only warehouse clubs. As of 2015, Costco was the second largest retailer in the world after Walmart, and as of 2016, Costco was the world’s largest retailer of choice and prime beef, organic foods, rotisserie chicken, and wine. Costco is ranked #15 on the Fortune 500 rankings of the largest United States corporations by total revenue.
You can download the Costco logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Costco
item.description: Costco Wholesale Corporation, doing business as Costco, is an American multinational corporation which operates a chain of membership-only warehouse clubs. As of 2015, Costco was the second largest retailer in the world after Walmart, and as of 2016, Costco was the world’s largest retailer of choice and prime beef, organic foods, rotisserie chicken, and wine. Costco is ranked #15 on the Fortune 500 rankings of the largest United States corporations by total revenue.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Team Knowhow Logo Team Knowhow believe everyone has the right to expert help with all technology. That’s why, whatever it is and wherever you bought it, we’ll help you get more from the kit that matters most to you. When you’re looking for something new, Team Knowhow nationwide team of in-store experts offers friendly, impartial advice – and Team Knowhow’ll help you get it home and set it up with no fuss.
You can download the Team Knowhow logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Team Knowhow
item.description: Team Knowhow believe everyone has the right to expert help with all technology. That’s why, whatever it is and wherever you bought it, we’ll help you get more from the kit that matters most to you. When you’re looking for something new, Team Knowhow nationwide team of in-store experts offers friendly, impartial advice – and Team Knowhow’ll help you get it home and set it up with no fuss.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 CVS Pharmacy Logo
CVS Pharmacy is a subsidiary of the American retail and health care company CVS Health, headquartered in Woonsocket, Rhode Island. It was also known as, and originally named, the Consumer Value Store and was founded in Lowell, Massachusetts, in 1963. The chain was owned by its original holding company Melville Corporation since its inception until its current parent company (CVS Health) was spun off into its own company in 1996.
You can download the CVS logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: CVS
item.description: CVS Pharmacy is a subsidiary of the American retail and health care company CVS Health, headquartered in Woonsocket, Rhode Island. It was also known as, and originally named, the Consumer Value Store and was founded in Lowell, Massachusetts, in 1963. The chain was owned by its original holding company Melville Corporation since its inception until its current parent company (CVS Health) was spun off into its own company in 1996.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Duane Reade Logo Duane Reade Inc. (/dweɪn ˈriːd/ dwayn-REED) is a chain of pharmacy and convenience stores owned by Walgreens Boots Alliance. They are primarily located in New York City, known for its high volume small store layouts in densely populated Manhattan locations. In 2012 the company headquarters was moved to 40 Wall Street in Lower Manhattan, the location of its newest flagship store. Source
You can download the Duane Reade logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

In 2012 the company headquarters was moved to 40 Wall Street in Lower Manhattan, the location of its newest flagship store. Source

The Home Depot Logo Home Depot is an American home improvement supplies retailing company that sells tools, construction products, and services. The company is headquartered at the Atlanta Store Support Center in unincorporated Cobb County, Georgia (with an Atlanta mailing address). Source
You can download the Home Depot logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

Toys'Я'Us Logo Toys “R” Us is an international toy, clothing, video game, and baby product Retail owned by Tru Kids, Inc. (d.b.a. Tru Kids Brands) and various others. It was founded in April 1948, with its headquarters located in Wayne, New Jersey, in the New York metropolitan area. Source
You can download the Toys R Us logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Walgreens Logo
Walgreen Company or simply Walgreens is an American company that operates as the second-largest pharmacy store chain in the United States behind CVS Health. It specializes in filling prescriptions, health and wellness products, health information, and photo services. As of August 31, 2018, the company operated 9,560 stores in all 50 states, the District of Columbia and the US territories of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. It was founded in Chicago, Illinois, in 1901.
You can download the Walgreens logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Walgreens
item.description: Walgreen Company or simply Walgreens is an American company that operates as the second-largest pharmacy store chain in the United States behind CVS Health. It specializes in filling prescriptions, health and wellness products, health information, and photo services. As of August 31, 2018, the company operated 9,560 stores in all 50 states, the District of Columbia and the US territories of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. It was founded in Chicago, Illinois, in 1901.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 7-eleven Logo
7-Eleven Inc. is a Japanese-owned American international chain of convenience stores, headquartered in Dallas, Texas. The chain was founded in 1927 as Tote’m Stores until it was renamed in 1946. Its parent company since 2005, Seven-Eleven Japan Co., Ltd., operates, franchises, and licenses 68,236 stores in 17 countries as of June 2019. Seven-Eleven Japan is headquartered in Chiyoda, Tokyo and held by Seven & I Holdings Co., Ltd.. The most recent franchise agreement gives up to 59% of a franchise’s gross profit to the company.
You can download the 7-eleven logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: 7-eleven
item.description: 7-Eleven Inc. is a Japanese-owned American international chain of convenience stores, headquartered in Dallas, Texas. The chain was founded in 1927 as Tote’m Stores until it was renamed in 1946. Its parent company since 2005, Seven-Eleven Japan Co., Ltd., operates, franchises, and licenses 68,236 stores in 17 countries as of June 2019. Seven-Eleven Japan is headquartered in Chiyoda, Tokyo and held by Seven & I Holdings Co., Ltd.. The most recent franchise agreement gives up to 59% of a franchise’s gross profit to the company.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Best Buy Logo Best Buy Co., Inc. is an American multinational consumer electronics Retail headquartered in Richfield, Minnesota. It was originally founded by Richard M. Schulze and James Wheeler in 1966 as an audio specialty store called Sound of Music. In 1983, it was re-branded under its current name with an emphasis placed on consumer electronics. Source
You can download the Best Buy logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

Schulze and James Wheeler in 1966 as an audio specialty store called Sound of Music. In 1983, it was re-branded under its current name with an emphasis placed on consumer electronics. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 eBay Logo
eBay Inc. (/ˈiːˌbeɪ/ EE-bay) is an American multinational e-commerce corporation based in San Jose, California that facilitates consumer-to-consumer and business-to-consumer sales through its website. eBay was founded by Pierre Omidyar in the autumn of 1995, and became a notable success story of the dot-com bubble. eBay is a multibillion-dollar business with operations in about 30 countries, as of 2011. The company manages the eBay website, an online auction and shopping website in which people and businesses buy and sell a wide variety of goods and services worldwide.
You can download the eBay logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: eBay
item.description: eBay Inc. (/ˈiːˌbeɪ/ EE-bay) is an American multinational e-commerce corporation based in San Jose, California that facilitates consumer-to-consumer and business-to-consumer sales through its website. eBay was founded by Pierre Omidyar in the autumn of 1995, and became a notable success story of the dot-com bubble. eBay is a multibillion-dollar business with operations in about 30 countries, as of 2011. The company manages the eBay website, an online auction and shopping website in which people and businesses buy and sell a wide variety of goods and services worldwide.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 GAP Logo
Gap was founded in 1969 by Donald Fisher and Doris F. Fisher and is headquartered in San Francisco, California. The company operates six primary divisions: Gap (the namesake banner), Banana Republic, Old Navy, Intermix, Hill City, and Athleta . Gap Inc. is the largest specialty Retail in the United States, and is 3rd in total international locations, behind Inditex Group and H&M. As of September 2008, the company has approximately 135,000 employees and operates 3,727 stores worldwide, of which 2,406 are located in the U.
You can download the GAP logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: GAP
item.description: Gap was founded in 1969 by Donald Fisher and Doris F. Fisher and is headquartered in San Francisco, California. The company operates six primary divisions: Gap (the namesake banner), Banana Republic, Old Navy, Intermix, Hill City, and Athleta . Gap Inc. is the largest specialty Retail in the United States, and is 3rd in total international locations, behind Inditex Group and H&M. As of September 2008, the company has approximately 135,000 employees and operates 3,727 stores worldwide, of which 2,406 are located in the U.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 H&M Hennes & Mauritz AB Logo
Hennes & Mauritz AB is a Swedish multinational clothing-retail company known for its fast-fashion clothing for men, women, teenagers and children. H&M and its associated companies operate in 62 countries with over 4,500 stores and as of 2015 employed around 132,000 people. It is the second-largest global clothing Retail, just behind Spain-based Inditex (parent company of Zara). The company has a significant online presence, with online shopping available in 33 countries:
You can download the H&M logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: H&M
item.description: Hennes & Mauritz AB is a Swedish multinational clothing-retail company known for its fast-fashion clothing for men, women, teenagers and children. H&M and its associated companies operate in 62 countries with over 4,500 stores and as of 2015 employed around 132,000 people. It is the second-largest global clothing Retail, just behind Spain-based Inditex (parent company of Zara). The company has a significant online presence, with online shopping available in 33 countries:

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Hermès Logo Hermès International S.A., or simply Hermès is a French high fashion luxury goods manufacturer established in 1837. It specializes in leather, lifestyle accessories, home furnishings, perfumery, jewellery, watches and ready-to-wear. Its logo, since the 1950s, is of a Duc carriage with horse. Nadège Vanhee-Cybulski is the current creative director. Source
You can download the Hermes logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Hermes
item.description: Hermès International S.A., or simply Hermès is a French high fashion luxury goods manufacturer established in 1837. It specializes in leather, lifestyle accessories, home furnishings, perfumery, jewellery, watches and ready-to-wear. Its logo, since the 1950s, is of a Duc carriage with horse. Nadège Vanhee-Cybulski is the current creative director. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 IKEA Logo
IKEA is a Swedish-founded multinational group that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture, kitchen appliances and home products, among other useful goods and occasionally home services. It has been the world’s largest furniture Retail since at least 2008. It was founded in Sweden in 1943 by 17-year-old carpenter Ingvar Kamprad, who was listed by Forbes in 2015 as one of the ten richest people in the world, worth more than $40 billion.
You can download the IKEA logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: IKEA
item.description: IKEA is a Swedish-founded multinational group that designs and sells ready-to-assemble furniture, kitchen appliances and home products, among other useful goods and occasionally home services. It has been the world’s largest furniture Retail since at least 2008. It was founded in Sweden in 1943 by 17-year-old carpenter Ingvar Kamprad, who was listed by Forbes in 2015 as one of the ten richest people in the world, worth more than $40 billion.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
JC Penney Logo J. C. Penney Company, is an American department store chain with 864 locations in 49 U.S. states and Puerto Rico. In addition to selling conventional merchandise, J. C. Penney stores often house several leased departments such as Sephora, Seattle’s Best Coffee, salons, auto centers, optical centers, portrait studios, and jewelry repair. Source
You can download the JC Penney logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Shiseido (資生堂) Logo
Shiseido Company, Limited is a Japanese multinational personal care company, that is a skin care, hair care, cosmetics and fragrance producer. It is one of the oldest cosmetics companies in the world. Founded in 1872, it celebrated its 140th anniversary in 2012. It is the largest cosmetic firm in Japan and the fifth largest cosmetics company in the world.[Shiseido is only available at cosmetic counters at selected department stores or pharmacists.
You can download the Shiseido logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Shiseido
item.description: Shiseido Company, Limited is a Japanese multinational personal care company, that is a skin care, hair care, cosmetics and fragrance producer. It is one of the oldest cosmetics companies in the world. Founded in 1872, it celebrated its 140th anniversary in 2012. It is the largest cosmetic firm in Japan and the fifth largest cosmetics company in the world.[Shiseido is only available at cosmetic counters at selected department stores or pharmacists.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Staples Logo Staples Inc. is a Massachusetts-based retail company. It is primarily involved in the sale of office supplies and related products, via retail channels and business-to-business (B2B)-oriented delivery operations. Source The new logo takes the old staple, opens it up, and turns into a table, or at least that’s my interpretation based on the chair graphic used in multiple other places. Still, with Staples placing more emphasis on its B2B operation, the redesign will have its biggest impact there.
You can download the Staples logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Staples
item.description: Staples Inc. is a Massachusetts-based retail company. It is primarily involved in the sale of office supplies and related products, via retail channels and business-to-business (B2B)-oriented delivery operations. Source The new logo takes the old staple, opens it up, and turns into a table, or at least that’s my interpretation based on the chair graphic used in multiple other places. Still, with Staples placing more emphasis on its B2B operation, the redesign will have its biggest impact there.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
UNIQLO (ユニクロ) Logo Uniqlo Co., Ltd. is a Japanese casual wear designer, manufacturer and Retail. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. The company operates in Japan and several other countries. Source
You can download the UNIQLO logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: UNIQLO
item.description: Uniqlo Co., Ltd. is a Japanese casual wear designer, manufacturer and Retail. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. The company operates in Japan and several other countries. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Zara SA Logo
Zara SA is a Spanish fast fashion (clothing and accessories) Retail based in Arteixo (A Coruña) in Galicia. The company was founded in 1975 by Amancio Ortega and Rosalía Mera. It is the main brand of the Inditex group, the world’s largest apparel Retail. The fashion group also owns brands such as Massimo Dutti, Pull&Bear, Bershka, Stradivarius, Oysho, Zara Home, and Uterqüe. Zara as of 2017 manages up to 20 clothing collections a year.
You can download the Zara logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Zara
item.description: Zara SA is a Spanish fast fashion (clothing and accessories) Retail based in Arteixo (A Coruña) in Galicia. The company was founded in 1975 by Amancio Ortega and Rosalía Mera. It is the main brand of the Inditex group, the world’s largest apparel Retail. The fashion group also owns brands such as Massimo Dutti, Pull&Bear, Bershka, Stradivarius, Oysho, Zara Home, and Uterqüe. Zara as of 2017 manages up to 20 clothing collections a year.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Target Corporation Logo
Target Corporation is the eighth-largest Retail in the United States, and is a component of the S&P 500 Index. Founded by George Dayton and headquartered in Minneapolis, the company was originally named Goodfellow Dry Goods in June 1902 before being renamed the Dayton’s Dry Goods Company in 1903 and later the Dayton Company in 1910. The first Target store opened in Roseville, Minnesota in 1962 while the parent company was renamed the Dayton Corporation in 1967.
You can download the Target logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Target
item.description: Target Corporation is the eighth-largest Retail in the United States, and is a component of the S&P 500 Index. Founded by George Dayton and headquartered in Minneapolis, the company was originally named Goodfellow Dry Goods in June 1902 before being renamed the Dayton’s Dry Goods Company in 1903 and later the Dayton Company in 1910. The first Target store opened in Roseville, Minnesota in 1962 while the parent company was renamed the Dayton Corporation in 1967.
